bug.author: prathik-naidu
bug.summary: MxNet Pre-trained Prediction Doc Not Working
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
The predict image doc page: <denchmark-link:url>https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/tutorials/python/predict_image.html</denchmark-link> doesn't work right off the shelf (returns incorrect predictions). <denchmark-h:h2>Problem</denchmark-h>
The tutorial doesn't normalize the images â€“ causing incorrect predictions to be made. For newcomers to MxNet/deep learning, I think this is a simple, but useful addition to add in. <denchmark-h:h2>Solution</denchmark-h>
Add in a color normalization in the get_image method as follows: def get_image(url, show=False): # download and show the image. Remove query string from the file name. fname = mx.test_utils.download(url, fname=url.split('/')[-1].split('?')[0]) img = mx.image.imread(fname) if img is None: return None if show: plt.imshow(img.asnumpy()) plt.axis('off') # convert into format (batch, RGB, width, height) img = mx.image.imresize(img, 224, 224) # resize #--------------------------- img = img.astype(float)/255 img = mx.image.color_normalize(img, mean=mx.nd.array([0.485, 0.456, 0.406]).astype(float), std=mx.nd.array([0.229, 0.224, 0.225]).astype(float) #--------------------------- img = img.transpose((2, 0, 1)) # Channel first img = img.expand_dims(axis=0) # batchify return img

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/prathik-naidu>@prathik-naidu</denchmark-link> I think that model may actually have been trained without normalization. I receive worse results if I apply normalization to the data. The top one is: probability=0.060943, class=n01930112 nematode, nematode worm, roundworm which is clearly worse than original one: probability=0.249607, class=n02119022 red fox, Vulpes vulpes If I change model to Gluon one (resnet18 = vision.resnet18_v1(pretrained=True)), then it is clear that it was trained with normalization in place. With normalization I get: probability=8.849780, class=n02124075 Egyptian cat, without I get: probability=60.358135, class=n04270147 spatula So, I am not sure how this model was trained. It could be that it actually didn't use normalization. What results do you get if you apply normalization?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/prathik-naidu>@prathik-naidu</denchmark-link> Did you get a chance to look into results after applying normalization?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/prathik-naidu>@prathik-naidu</denchmark-link> I ran the predictions with the mxnet-1.3.0 and see same predictions as mentioned in the example itself. As <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sergeykolychev>@sergeykolychev</denchmark-link> pointed out the predictions get worse with normalisation and maybe the model was trained without normalisation.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/prathik-naidu>@prathik-naidu</denchmark-link>
This model has been trained without normalization and doesn't need its input normalized, contrary to the Gluon model zoo one that needs its input normalized. So closing the issue as the example is working as expected. Please feel free to re-open if closed in error. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sandeep-krishnamurthy>@sandeep-krishnamurthy</denchmark-link> Could you please close the issue
